intro: Schkuhria biternata, commonly known as the three-parted yarrow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and showy composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its aromatic foliage. It produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by white to pale pink ray florets. Schkuhria biternata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
